creator.name_english: Councillors / Councils of Policy and Justice / fiscal of St Martin
creator.his_func: In 1703 the West India Company (WIC) gained direct control over St Martin. Administratively, the colony became a dependency of St Eustatius. The Commander of the three Windward islands, seated on St Eustatius, was represented by a Vice-Commander who administered St Martin together with a Council of citizens. The Council consisted of the Vice-Commander and four of the most able and prominent citizens, including the captain of the militia. Until 1802 the Vice-Commander and Councillors attended to both the affairs of policy and the administration of civil and criminal justice.
